result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody R. Hamann-Weide was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).
  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 14CF140 and 15CF82 called together at 8:35 am [mo]
Defendant Cody R. Hamann-Weide in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 14CF140:
The Court and Counsel discuss the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, specifically the revocation/ termination of the agreement. 
The Court acknowledges receipt of the Therapy Progress Report submitted by the Defense.
---The Court reviews the Report
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance; and notifies the Court that she will be making statements on behalf of the victim/victim's family

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Teuber
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Witt

On Counts #1, #2 and #3, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years on each count concurrent, with conditions:

--On Count #1 to serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on  5/26/15 at   7:00pm.
---Mr. Hamann-Weide is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--No Contact with M.R.L. (DOB: 9/30/2001)
--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--On Count #1 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #2 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for expungement on the case.

Atty. Witt requests the Therapy Progress Report be sealed in the court file based on the sensitive nature of the report and victim information
The Court orders The Therapy Progress Report is to be sealed in the file. 


In Case 14CF140: Days credit for time already served:  1 day

As to Case 15CF82:
Atty. Witt requests a status conference date
No objection from the state
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling 
The Court reminds Mr. Hamann- Weide that his bond and its conditions in this file remain in effect
recess: 9:11am

Case called at 4:07 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for arraignment)
Defendant Cody R. Hamann-Weide in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Witt: Here for arraignment today, have been waiting for evaluation which was received today. Do need some time for ADA Teuber to review information. Request matter be set over a couple weeks as is likely they will be proceeding on different charge.
ADA Hall: No objection
Court informs parties that if the case will go to disposition, would prefer that case is heard before this Court and not reserve
Court reminds Defendant that bond and conditions of bond remain in effect as case is pending.
Recess: 4:09 pm

Case called at 8:41 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Cody R. Hamann-Weide in court with Attorney Michael C Witt. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Hamann-Weide waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
ADA Beck indicates that final charging decision has not yet been made; requests 30 days to file information & have arraignment held at a later date
Counsel agree that arraignment date can fall outside 30 days
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending

Scheduling Notice

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch 3 Intake.
Case called at 1:16 pm.  

Defendant Cody R. Hamann-Weide in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will represent). ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Zarwell informs the Court that the video connection is sight and sound sufficient.

Service of Complaint admitted and maximum penalties recited.
Preliminary Hearing Time limits waived by both Parties

Court requires $25,000 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No direct or indirect contact with M.R.L. DOB (9-30-01) or her parents
-No presence at M.R.L's home or school
-No physical contact with juvenile females under the age of 18 
-No use of the Internet with exception of work or school purposes
-No use of social media
-A daily curfew to home from 9:00 pm to 7:30 am.

Recess: 1:27
